title: Honoring Christina Ames upon the occasion of her designation as a Young Arts finalist in musical theater
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  congratulating Christina Ames upon the occasion
of her designation as a Young Arts finalist in musical theater

WHEREAS, It is the sense of this Legislative Body  to  commend  and  pay
tribute  to  those young people who, by achieving outstanding success in
an educational, musical and  artistic  competition,  have  inspired  and
brought pride to our majestic Empire State; and
  WHEREAS,  Attendant to such concern, and in full accord with its long-
standing traditions, this Legislative Body is justly proud to  congratu-
late Christina Ames upon the occasion of her designation as a Young Arts
finalist in musical theater; and
  WHEREAS,  A  student  at  Wheatley  School, in Old Westbury, New York,
Christina Ames was chosen from more than 6,000 applicants in nine disci-
plines in the visual, literary and performing arts to be  a  Young  Arts
finalist in musical theater; and
  WHEREAS, Christina Ames will embark on a once-in-a-lifetime experience
provided  by Young Arts, the core program of the National Foundation for
Advancement in the Arts; and
  WHEREAS, Joining some 150 finalists for  Young  Arts  Week  in  Miami,
Florida,  January  10-15,  2011,  for  masters  classes  by world renown
artists, Christina Ames is eligible to be named a Gold and Silver winner
and travel to New York, as well as the  possibility  of  being  named  a
Presidential Scholar in the Arts; and
  WHEREAS,  Students  attending Young Arts Week were selected in a blind
adjudication process from a pool representing  all  50  states  and  the
District of Columbia, as well as United States' territories; the adjudi-
cation  process continues during the week to determine the Gold, Silver,
Level I, Level II and Level III winners; and
  WHEREAS, Gold and Silver winners have the opportunity to travel to New
York in the spring for the In Studio series, an additional week of work-
shops, collaborative performance and exhibitions; and
  WHEREAS, During Young  Arts  Week,  adjudicators  will  also  nominate
students  as  2011  Presidential Scholars in the Arts, an award given at
the White House, with the opportunity to perform at the  Kennedy  Center
and  exhibit at the Smithsonian American Art Museum in Washington, D.C.;
and
  WHEREAS, It is appropriate to celebrate the individual accomplishments
of remarkable students  who  participate  in  educational,  musical  and
artistic  competition  and  who have achieved noteworthy recognition for
their artistic efforts; and
  WHEREAS, Christina Ames' outstanding performance has  clearly  made  a
contribution  to the spirit of excellence which is a tradition of Wheat-
ley School; and
  WHEREAS, This Legislative Body  is  proud  to  recognize  and  applaud
Christina Ames for her outstanding artistic success and achievement; and
  WHEREAS,  It  is the sense of this Legislative Body that when an indi-
vidual of such noble aims and notable accomplishments is brought to  our
attention,  she  should  be recognized by all the citizens of this great
Empire State; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED, That this Legislative Body pause  in  its  deliberations  to
congratulate  Christina  Ames  upon the occasion of her designation as a
Young Arts finalist in musical theater; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Christina Ames.
